10$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/15/2018 4:42:39 PM$Reviewer: SC-Scribe
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$1$The drug screwed up my sleep cycle
column3: and so taking it was very difficult. I wanted to give it a fair shake on the ADD
column4: so kept at it. Then I developed odd neurological tingling / twitches in my fingers. Didn't associate it with the drug. THEN
column5: a horrible neurological condition struck
column6: and I was rushed to the hospital. It was hypokalemia -- low potassium -- and it was life-threatening. Bupropion
column9: my business partner's boyfriend was a few months later taking it for smoking cessation; she had to drive him to the hospital for the same reason. So just be aware!

column1: 17$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/11/2017 1:00:59 PM$Reviewer: DB
column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$5$4$Doctor gave me this to help with the anxiety that is caused by my ADHD/ADD until I could get in to see a psychiatrist. Must say it has worked wonders. The first day
column3: it released the ADD and actually made it worse. Think of taking chains (anxiety) off the disease and letting it run wild. The second day was better. Noticed a little irritable at common tasks throughout the day. The third day
column4: I was completely normal. I had motivation to get things done and haven't had any desire to procrastinate. The ADHD and ADD is still there and I can notice it but it doesn't make me anxious about it.

column1: 69$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/14/2014 11:09:47 AM$Reviewer: JBourne

column3: I asked my wife for feedback on my general behavior and she said there's no change.  I don't feel much different and I'm wondering if I chould just go off the medication and try dealing with life again with no drugs.

column1: 78$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$5/8/2014 10:43:22 PM$Reviewer: PR PRINCESS

column1: 404$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/12/2016 6:11:06 PM$Reviewer: Taddy
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$4$3$At first
column3: I was given 100mg/day and did not notice hardly any change over the first month. (The only side-effect was a few headaches.) Then
column4: it was increased to 150mg x 2/day
column5: which I took for a month and though I had more energy
column6: I didn't think it helped my Adult ADD/ADHD much (not wanting a stimulant)
column7: so I abruptly stopped taking it at the end of the 2nd month (time for a refill). I already take Zoloft for depression
column8: which works well. A side-effect of cessation is intense fatigue/tiredness. Yet
column9: I seem to be MUCH more distracted now (having thought I was not much more focused). Yet
column10: I believe it must have helped me some
column11: so I am going back on it asap!

column1: 406$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/18/2014 1:01:14 AM$Reviewer: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I have anxiety problems due to the combination of ADHD and Asperger's
column2: and Bupropion has seriously helped. I have taken this my entire life
column3: with the exception of my early years up to fifth grade. I recently went through a stint where I had tried to go off it once I had learned it was primarily an anti-depressant
column4: and I began having problematic panic attacks and would go through periods in which I could not stop crying. Since being back on this
column5: I must say I am satisfied with it. I have been off Concerta for a year
column6: and Bupropion has helped me to also keep my ADHD problems(impulsiveness
column7: hyperactivity) in check. I know this whole review probably doesn't matter too much
column8: but I wanted to give some insight for people with ADHD who are either starting or debating starting this medication. I see a lot of reviews from people who are taking this for depression
column9: so it'd be good to see something from someone with ADHD. There are much fewer and less present side effects than Clonidine
column10: so to me it's a good alternative.

column1: 432$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/13/2017 6:06:13 PM$Reviewer: love

Needless to say I threw the prescription out. If you have sensitive ears

column1: 738$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/30/2018 7:57:44 PM$Reviewer: sunnyflower
column2: 13-18 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $2$1$2$I've been on this medication for about 2 months. When I first started taking it (75mg)
column3: I noticed an increase in acne
column4: but I didn't yet connect it to the medication. I thought it may have simply been due to stress. Then when I increased my dosage to 150mg
column5: my acne got much worse. It was very shocking
column6: as I never really had more than a few pimples before. But now my forehead is covered in bumps and angry
column7: red pimples. This typically isn't included as a side effect
column8: but online I've found that many other people got cystic acne after taking this drug.

column1: 742$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/11/2018 1:33:05 PM$Reviewer: dvdblack
column2: 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$4$3$I've been on Wellbutrin Xr 300mg 4 months. It has helped with my mood. I feel like I can start getting things done easier. I put somewhat effective because it helps me to focus on things I already know how to do. Keeping focus when learning new things was a challenge. When I take it in the morning I don't feel like going back to bed. I am able to either get things done or relax and watch TV. It doesn't give me the feeling that I HAVE to be doing something. I was able to go to work after taking it. Although I did have anxiety when talking to people at work. Mostly because I felt different. That feeling went away after 5 days. I never felt uncomfortable while being out and about. Just in case I feel I should let you know I started at 150mg for 4 weeks then went to 300mg. That is the normal way to start. Plus when I went up in mg I had no ill effects.

column1: 777$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/1/2015 9:27:22 PM$Reviewer: me again
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$I have anxiety and sometimes have panic attacks. Also I suffer from depression which is sometimes quite severe. It's a horrible one-two punch which almost made my life unbearable. My doctor and I first tried Zoloft which we gradually increased in dosage. It worked to some degree but not completely and I had severe side effects. After consulting with my pharmacist and doctor and the two of them consulting together we worked out a treatment which cut down my Zoloft and added a moderate dosage of Wellbutrin. This has worked perfectly for me with few side effects.

column1: 1175$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/6/2009 7:00:54 PM$Reviewer: torrie
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$"Evaluated w/A.D.D.& depression. Put on W. Was told it could take up to 2-3 wks. to take effect. ONLT TOOK 3 DAYS!!! It was the absolute BEST drug that I've ever taken for BOTH the depression AND the A.D.D.! I was actually a functioning
column3: NORMAL
column4: NO-MIND-RACING-able to focus
column5: AGAIN-NORMAL human being! HORRIBLY- in my case-this only lasted for a little over 3 months. After that
column6: it slowly began to go back to my old ""normal"" (abnormal)? self. I was heartbroken! My Dr. explained that this sometimes happens and that believe it or not the drug was still working. No-it wasn't. ALL of the old symptoms re-appeared. If they could only find a way to make the effects of this drug last
column7: SO many people with the same problems could be helped. I should add that I also had (still do)chronic fatigue(it's a.d.d.-NOT a.d.h.d.)chronic pain & fibro. Wellbutrin was amazing! I should also add that I took it BEFORE it was used as a smoking cessasion drug and it DID help me to cut WAY back on cigarette consumption!(Who knew)? Anyway-hope this can help someone else.I should ALSO note that this was a little over 10 yrs. ago."

column1: 1416$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/26/2008 7:45:10 PM$Reviewer: Ken
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$4$5$"Works well for ADHD/ADD combination. Mostly inattentive. Jittery for about 4 months. It buys me that extra second I need to keep from putting my foot in my mouth.

column1: I wanted to try this as I detest the crash of the mainline ADD drugs. DR. also tells me there should be less of the dosage creep of adderal
column2: etc.

column1: On 300 MG and happy as a clam. It also cured my cold sleeping. Went from 5"" of covers in July (GA) to sheet and single blanket. A very unexpected bonus and worth the price of admission alone.
It does not do a lot for racing thoughts. It seems to give me the patience to put up with them. It does allow me to stop and remember where I put things. As a result
column2: I can function much better out in my shop. (Less time looking for tools.) As a teacher it helps me handle the paperwork.

column1: It won't solve all the ADD issues
column2: but it is buying me time to ge back on track. ADD diagnosed age 8
column3: 53 now. No drugs for last 32 years. Only script I take. Death of wife/ADD Coach knocked me out of sync. I am quite happy with things for now."

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $1$1$5$I am A physical therapist and I was in cronic neck and upper bacj pain.  It gave me horrible anxiety
column3: palpatations and made me very edgy.  It also prevented my from falling asleep which is obviously a problem within itself.  I knew my pain was not from my job
column4: posture
column5: or poor ergonomics.  Once q went from 300mg to 150mg
column6: most of my upper back pain was abolished.  When I quit cold turkey (you can with tis drug unlike SSRI's)
column7: my neck pain was abilished!!!   In the future when I take in a new patient
column8: I will make sure to see if they are on buproprion.  I think this drug should yanked off the market by the FDA!   My wife was prescribed it for bipolar
column9: and she became so full of anxiety that she could'nt even concentrate to prepare a typical meal!

column1: 2281$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/16/2010 2:29:21 PM$Reviewer: Productive patient in society
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$4$Not only do I have ADHD but I have Bi-Polar disorder as well!  I was afraid that because of the limitations with meds I'd have to experiment with the Doctor for months before getting the right combination.  I added the Wellbutrin to my already 16 y.o. routine and have since been able to enjoy life and really focus on the moment I am in at the time. I'm not 100% better but am far more functional than before.

column1: 2358$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/27/2009 12:04:16 AM$Reviewer: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver) $2$1$3$My granddaughter
column2: who is afflicted with Turner's Syndrom
column3: was born with many broken cromazones
column4: was put on Wellbutrin when she was about 10 years old to control her obsessive/compulsive hyperactive behavior. She began to withdraw from her normal behavior
column5: and her school work regressed to about a 2-3rd grade level.  Her memory was affected dramatically.  We removed her from the Wellbutrin treatment after we heard similar stories about the effects.  She began a slow recovery and is functioning at a high level now.  Her ability to know left from right
column6: tell time and several other skills that she had for several years were severely affected and she continues to struggle with some of these issues.

column1: 2385$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/16/2009 7:28:56 AM$Reviewer: DrewM

column7: the ONLY upshot was the sexual drive.  WHATEVER.

2675$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/27/2009 9:37:22 PM$Reviewer: Shopgirl
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I have mild-moderate adult ADD.  Initially I was prescribed this 150mg twice daily by my PCP and noticed a remarkable difference in my ability to focus and concentrate
column3: and it improved my mood.  Unfortunately the dosage was too high to start out with and I had very uncomfortable heart palpitations and was dropped back to 100mg twice daily.  That continued to help my mood and memory a great deal but I didn't have the benefit of the focus and concentration.  Now I'm seeing a psychiatrist and still taking 75mg daily of this plus some Ritalin
column4: which is helping me to concentrate better and not get as distracted.

column1: 2744$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/26/2008 4:38:06 AM$Reviewer: deannad
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$3$5$"In the fifth grade I was diagnosed with ADHD. I was originally prescribed Ritalin but can not take stimulants due to a weird reaction and I developed Tourettes Syndrome.  After years of trial and error with medications I have settled with Strattera 60mg and Wellbutrin XL 150 mg.  They work well together. The Wellbutrin helps with ADHD
column3: depression
column4: and helps balance the irritability I get from strattera
column5: however it does make me more anxious
column6: which is hard to live with.  The Strattera lets me concentrate and my grades are decent in my third year college.

column1: With any drug there are side affects but after six years the Wellbutrin is still working. It doesn't seem as harsh as other drugs and the weight management is just a bonus.  If I forget to take it my day is not so smooth.

2796$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/10/2008 10:04:37 PM$Reviewer: DaBoyz, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$4$5$I have a stew of depression (on Prozac for this), anxiety, and ADHD, with high blood pressure.  I was put on 300 mg Wellbutrin for ADHD as the safest option.  I have been amazed at how Wellbutrin has cleared the brainfog or brain static I have felt seemingly all my life.  My focus and concentration is much better now.  I still have some disorganization and forgetfulness but I am able to focus enough to use some tools to help with this.  I am not sure if I need to go up in dosage or not....but overall I am happy!

column1: 3061$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/21/2007 7:42:34 AM$Reviewer: sara
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$5$"Stimulants for Adult ADD did not work for me. Although I occaisionally feel agitated on this medication I found that it gives that ""motivation in a pill"" effect I've been hoping for. It has also helped me to stop smoking. It is very nice to wake up and have the motivation to do the dishes and clean up and feed my son a healthy breakfst instead of laying around on the couch or smoking a cigarette first thing. I felt that it gave me an ""attitude problem"" when i was first given this medication for depression
column3: but coupled with Effexor it is a dream come true for my ADHD symptoms. While on this medication my migrane headaches have gone away COMPLETELY and my overall blood pressure has lowered. My work has been more satisfying and less of a burden and it is easier to wake up at an ungodly hour to be there. I was also a habitual user of pot before starting this medication and have stopped smoking pot and cigaretters almost effortlessly. "
